alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued March 11 at 2:48PM CST until March 13 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 8 AM CST SATURDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29 expected Saturday morning. For the Wind Advisory, north winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 32 possible Sunday morning. * WHERE...Victoria County. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from 3 AM to 8 AM CST Saturday. For the Wind Advisory, until 6 AM CST Saturday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Saturday night through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
